title: QA Engineer Interview Guide
description: Demonstrate testing expertise and quality advocacy.

content.text: QA Engineer interviews assess your testing methodology, automation skills, and ability to be a quality advocate within development teams. Modern QA roles increasingly require coding and automation expertise.

**What interviewers assess:**

- Testing methodologies and strategies
- Test automation skills
- Bug identification and reproduction
- Quality process improvement
- Collaboration with developers

**Typical QA interview loop:**

1. **Recruiter screen** (30 min)
2. **Technical phone screen** (60 min) - Testing scenarios or automation
3. **Onsite/Virtual loop** (4-5 hours):
   - Test case design exercise
   - Automation/coding round
   - Bug investigation scenario
   - Behavioral round
When given a feature to test, think beyond happy paths. Edge cases, error handling, security, and performance are where bugs hide.

items.text: Practice designing test cases for common scenarios
Brush up on coding skills (test automation requires it)
Prepare examples of bugs you've found and their impact
Review the company's products and find potential test areas
Prepare stories about quality improvements you've driven
